course_description: This course covers the art and science of using financial and economic analysis to assess a company's current and potential value, or "strategic value."  A variety of financial and economic analytic tools and methodologies may be used (e.g. regression analysis, ratio analysis, ROI analysis, DCF and multiples analysis, cost of capital estimation, etc.) to understand an industry or the key value drivers of a business. The foregoing analysis should lead to insights regarding possible actions or new initiatives that a company can pursue in order to sustain or create value.
prerequisites: This section is reserved for students in the One-Year or Two-Year MBA program.
